questions.questionText: The prime factorisation of natural number 288 is
If 2 cos θ = 1, then the value of θ is
A card is drawn at random from a well-shuffled deck of 52 cards. The probability of getting a red card is:
The discriminant of the quadratic equation 2x² - 5x - 3 = 0 is
The distance between the points (3, 0) and (0, -3) is
The seventh term of an A.P. whose first term is 28 and common difference -4, is
The graph of y = p(x) is shown in the figure for some polynomial p(x). The number of zeroes of p(x) is/are:
The sides of two similar triangles are in the ratio 4 : 7. The ratio of their perimeters is
In the given figure, AB || CD. If AB = 5 cm, CD = 2 cm and OB = 3 cm, then the length of OC is
The sum and the product of zeroes of the polynomial p(x) = x² + 5x + 6 are respectively
A die is thrown once. Find the probability of getting a number less than 7.
The angle subtended by a vertical pole of height 100 m at a point on the ground 100√3 m from the base is, has measure of
The volume of a cone of radius 'r' and height '3r' is:
The distance between two parallel tangents of a circle of diameter 7 cm is:
In the given figure (triangles ABC and PQR with specific sides and angle 50°), the criterion of similarity by which ΔABC ~ ΔPQR is:
The larger of two supplementary angles exceeds the smaller by 18 degrees. What is the measure of larger angle?
questions.chapter: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables

questions.questionText: In the given figure, the perimeter of ΔABC is (given AR=6cm, AQ=5cm, BP=4cm):
In the given figure, BC and BD are tangents to the circle with centre O and radius 9 cm. If OB = 15 cm, then the length (BC + BD) is:
Assertion (A): A tangent to a circle is perpendicular to the radius through the point of contact. Reason (R): The lengths of tangents drawn from the external point to a circle are equal.

Assertion (A): The system of linear equations 3x + 5y - 4 = 0 and 15x + 25y - 25 = 0 is inconsistent. Reason (R): The pair of linear equations a1x + b1y + c1 = 0 and a2x + b2y + c2 = 0 is inconsistent if a1/a2 = b1/b2 ≠ c1/c2.
questions.chapter: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables

questions.questionText: (a) Find the coordinates of the point which divides the line segment joining the points (7, -1) and (-3, 4) internally in the ratio 2 : 3. OR (b) Find the value(s) of y for which the distance between the points A(3, -1) and B(11, y) is 10 units.
Evaluate tan² 60° - 2 cosec² 30° - 2 tan² 30°.
Find the LCM and HCF of 92 and 510, using prime factorisation.
(a) Solve for x and y: x + y = 6, 2x - 3y = 4. OR (b) Find out whether the following pair of linear equations are consistent or inconsistent: 5x - 3y = 11, -10x + 6y = 22.
questions.chapter: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables

questions.questionText: In the given figure, ABC and AMP are two right triangles, right angled at B and M, respectively. Prove that ΔABC ~ ΔAMP.
(a) Prove that sec θ (1 - sin θ)(sec θ + tan θ) = 1. OR (b) Prove that (1 + sec θ) / sec θ = sin² θ / (1 - cos θ).
Show that the points A(1, 7), B(4, 2), C(-1, -1) and D(-4, 4) are vertices of the square ABCD.
Prove that the tangents drawn from an external point to a circle are equal in length.
If α, β are zeroes of the quadratic polynomial x² + 3x + 2, find a quadratic polynomial whose zeroes are α + 1, β + 1.
Prove that 3 + 7√2 is an irrational number, given that √2 is an irrational number.

(a) In the given figure, DE || AC and DF || AE. Prove that BF/FE = BE/EC. OR (b) The diagonals of a quadrilateral ABCD intersect each other at the point O such that AO/BO = CO/OD. Show that quadrilateral ABCD is a trapezium.

(a) The diagonal of a rectangular field is 60 m more than the shorter side. If the longer side is 80 m more than the shorter side, find the length of the sides of the field. OR (b) The sum of the ages of a father and his son is 45 years. Five years ago, the product of their ages (in years) was 124. Determine their present age.

A vessel is in the form of a hemispherical bowl surmounted by a hollow cylinder of same diameter. The diameter of the hemispherical bowl is 14 cm and the total height of the vessel is 13 cm. Find the inner surface area of the vessel. Also, find the volume of the vessel.

The table given below shows the daily expenditure on food of 25 households in a locality. Find the mean daily expenditure on food. Also, find the mode of the data. (Expenditure: 100-150, 150-200, 200-250, 250-300, 300-350; Frequencies: 4, 5, 12, 2, 2)

(a) A TV tower stands vertically on the bank of a canal. From a point on the other bank directly opposite the tower, the angle of elevation of the top of the tower is 60°. From another point 20 m away from the point on the line joining this point to the foot of the tower, the angle of elevation of the top of the tower is 30°. Find the height of the tower. OR (b) An aeroplane when flying at a height of 4000 m from the ground passes vertically above another aeroplane at an instant when the angles of elevation of the two planes from the same point on the ground are 60° and 45° respectively. Find the vertical distance between the aeroplanes at that instant. (Use √3 = 1.73)

Aahana places pots in rows such that first row has 2, second row has 5, third row has 8 and so on. (i) Find the number of pots in 10th row. (ii) Find the difference in pots between 5th and 2nd row. (iii) If total pots are 100, find total rows. OR If 12 rows are available, find total pots.

A Rangoli design is in the shape of a square ABCD of side 40 cm. At each corner, a quadrant of radius 10 cm is drawn. A circle of diameter 20 cm is drawn in the middle. (i) Area of square ABCD? (ii) Area of the middle circle? (iii) Area of remaining portion if quadrants and circle are removed? OR Combined area of 4 quadrants and circle removed?
In a sample of 50 people, 21 had type O blood, 22 had type A, 5 had type B and rest had type AB. (i) Prob(Type O)? (ii) Prob(Type AB)? (iii) Prob(Neither A nor B)? OR Prob(Either A or B or O)?
